1.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to flee for protection; figuratively, to confide in
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
properly, to pale, i.e. by implication to be ashamed; also (by implication) to be disappointed or delayed
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always

2.brief: rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)
to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense
to slip out, i.e. escape; causatively, to deliver
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
near, with or among; often in general, to
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor

3.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, a cliff (or sharp rock, as compressed); generally, a rock or boulder; figuratively, a refuge; also an edge (as precipitous)
an abode, of God (the Tabernacle or the Temple), men (their home) or animals (their lair); hence, a retreat (asylum)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
properly, continuance (as indefinite extension); but used only (attributively as adjective) constant (or adverbially, constantly); ellipt. the regular (daily) sacrifice
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a craggy rock, literally or figuratively (a fortress)
a net, or (abstractly) capture; also a fastness
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you

to slip out, i.e. escape; causatively, to deliver
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power
to be pungent; i.e. in taste (sour, i.e. literally fermented, or figuratively, harsh), in color (dazzling)

5.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
literally a cord (as an attachment); figuratively, expectancy
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
properly, a refuge, i.e. (objective) security, or (subjective) assurance
(only in plural collectively or emphatic form) youth, the state (juvenility) or the persons (young people)

to prop (literally or figuratively); reflexively, to lean upon or take hold of (in a favorable or unfavorable sense)
the belly, especially the womb; also the bosom or body of anything

used only in plural the intestines, or (collectively) the abdomen, figuratively, sympathy; by implication, a vest; by extension the stomach, the uterus (or of men, the seat of generation), the heart (figuratively)
a mother (as the bond of the family); in a wide sense (both literally and figuratively (like father))
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
to cut off, i.e. portion out
properly, continuance (as indefinite extension); but used only (attributively as adjective) constant (or adverbially, constantly); ellipt. the regular (daily) sacrifice

7.brief: a miracle; by implication, a token or omen
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)

the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
ornament (abstractly or concretely, literally or figuratively)

to throw out, down or away (literally or figuratively)
time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.
to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume)
vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to loosen, i.e. relinquish, permit, etc.

to advise; reflexively, to deliberate or resolve
